choices.text: You are given two arrays $a$ and $b$ of positive integers, with length $n$ and $m$ respectively. Let $c$ be an $n \times m$ matrix, where $c_{i,j} = a_i \cdot b_j$. You need to find a subrectangle of the matrix $c$ such that the sum of its elements is at most $x$, and its area (the total number of elements) is the largest possible. Formally, you need to find the largest number $s$ such that it is possible to choose integers $x_1, x_2, y_1, y_2$ subject to $1 \leq x_1 \leq x_2 \leq n$, $1 \leq y_1 \leq y_2 \leq m$, $(x_2 - x_1 + 1) \times (y_2 - y_1 + 1) = s$, and $$\sum_{i=x_1}^{x_2}{\sum_{j=y_1}^{y_2}{c_{i,j}}} \leq x.$$
